com.webmethods.vcs

Interface VCSClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClient

    public interface VCSClient
    This class defines a set of contracts that any VCS should implement.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkin(java.util.List fileNames, java.lang.String description)
      Checks the files into the VCS.
      void checkout(java.util.List fileNames)
      Checks out the files from the VCS along with a list of file names referring to the elements in the VCS that should be checked out.
      void delete(boolean isPredelete, java.util.List fileNames, java.lang.String comment)
      Deletes a list of files from the VCS.
      java.util.List getInfo()
      Returns general VCS information.
      java.util.List getLog(java.lang.String fileName)
      Returns the log for the given file from the version control system.
      boolean isCheckedOut(java.lang.String fileName)
      Indicates whether the given file is checked out of the VCS.
      void load(java.util.List dirNames, java.util.List fileNames)
      Loads the current version of the elements, directories, and files recursively.
      void load(java.util.List dirNames, java.util.List fileNames, java.util.Date date)
      Loads the directories by date.
      void load(java.util.List dirNames, java.util.List fileNames, java.lang.String revision, boolean isInterface)
      Loads the directories by revision.
      void loadByLabel(java.util.List dirNames, java.util.List fileNames, java.lang.String label)
      Loads working copies of the directories by label.
      boolean mustDeleteBeforeLoad()
      Indicates whether this client must delete existing files before loading a new copy from the VCS.
      void revert(java.util.List fileNames)
      Reverts the given files.

    • Method Detail

      • getInfo

        java.util.List getInfo()
                throws VCSException
        Returns general VCS information. It returns information like vendor, version, and other general information about the VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • checkout

        void checkout(java.util.List fileNames)
       throws VCSException
        Checks out the files from the VCS along with a list of file names referring to the elements in the VCS that should be checked out.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • getLog

        java.util.List getLog(java.lang.String fileName)
               throws VCSException
        Returns the log for the given file from the version control system. The log is a list of responses from the version control on the file.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • checkin

        void checkin(java.util.List fileNames,
             java.lang.String description)
      throws VCSException
        Checks the files into the VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • load

        void load(java.util.List dirNames,
          java.util.List fileNames,
          java.util.Date date)
   throws VCSException
        Loads the directories by date. The working copy from the VCS is retrieved by date. It does not lock any element in VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • load

        void load(java.util.List dirNames,
          java.util.List fileNames,
          java.lang.String revision,
          boolean isInterface)
   throws VCSException
        Loads the directories by revision. The working copy from the VCS is retrieved using revision assigned to the element in VCS. It does not lock any element in VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • load

        void load(java.util.List dirNames,
          java.util.List fileNames)
   throws VCSException
        Loads the current version of the elements, directories, and files recursively. It does not lock any element in VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • loadByLabel

        void loadByLabel(java.util.List dirNames,
                 java.util.List fileNames,
                 java.lang.String label)
          throws VCSException
        Loads working copies of the directories by label. The working copy from the VCS is retrieved using label assigned to the element in VCS. It does not lock any element in VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • delete

        void delete(boolean isPredelete,
            java.util.List fileNames,
            java.lang.String comment)
     throws VCSException
        Deletes a list of files from the VCS. Any reasons for deletion should be passed as comment.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • revert

        void revert(java.util.List fileNames)
     throws VCSException
        Reverts the given files.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • isCheckedOut

        boolean isCheckedOut(java.lang.String fileName)
              throws VCSException
        Indicates whether the given file is checked out of the VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException

      • mustDeleteBeforeLoad

        boolean mustDeleteBeforeLoad()
                      throws VCSException
        Indicates whether this client must delete existing files before loading a new copy from the VCS.
        Throws:
        VCSException
